meanings.definition: To align or position oneself in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: She was orientating herself towards the rising sun.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was orientating the map to face north.
meanings.sent3: While orientating herself, she accidentally walked into a pole.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were orientating towards a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle was orientating steadily towards the north.

meanings.definition: To familiarize oneself with new surroundings or information.
meanings.sent1: The new student was orientating around the school campus.
meanings.sent2: She spent the morning orientating herself with the office procedures.
meanings.sent3: While orientating with the new software, he clicked on all the wrong buttons.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was orientating to the complex data like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The detective was orientating himself with the crime scene for clues.
